}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== :Other board revisions appear to have a different SoC! Likely changed by Netgear due to jitter and latency issues associated with the cable modem side of the Puma 6. Some modems use a '''Broadcom BCM33843''' SoC instead. This was verified by removing the main heatsink. The board in the images also appears to be a BCM33843 board, due to the silkscreen markings on an unpopulated serial header on the underside of the PCB.
:It's using a '''CUS223''' 802.11ac module. *[http://www.dslreports.com/hardware/Netgear-C6300-h4013 ''Netgear C6300'' on '''DSL Reports''']
===Likely compatible services=== *{{Approved by service|Comcast}} ([http://mydeviceinfo.comcast.net/device.php?devid=401 '''Comcast''' device database entry])
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/other/ces-2014/32299-netgear-ces-2014-announcements ''Netgear CES 2014 Announcements'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :It's noted as using an ''[[Intel Puma]]'' 6 SoC using a 16x4 configuration.
